intro: Sempervivum armenum var. armenum, commonly known as Armenian houseleek, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It features dense, rosette-shaped foliage composed of thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. This hardy perennial is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative ground cover due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
